  • Method Details

    • i_see_the_text_appears_on_pages_of_the_pdf

      @Then("^I see the text (.*) appears (?:on|between) the (\\d+)(?:st|nd|rd|th)(?: and )?(\\d+)?(?:st|nd|rd|th)? pages? of the pdf$") public static void i_see_the_text_appears_on_pages_of_the_pdf​(java.lang.String text_to_verify, int firstPageNumber, java.lang.Integer lastPageNumber) throws java.lang.Throwable
      Validates whether the currently open pdf contains the given text on the page(s) passed to it. If a page number is passed for the first page and a null is passed for the second page, then only that page is searched. If two page numbers are passed, then the entire range is searched, inclusive of the two page numbers given.

      Gherkin Examples:

      • Then I see the text Validation Text appears on the 3rd page of the pdf
      • Then I see the text 1Q2W3E_4R5T appears between the 1st and 4th pages of the pdf
      NOTE: This will fail if the browser window is not currently open with a pdf loaded. Should be executed after the i_open_the_document_with_extension_in_a_new_tab(linkName,extension) method is called. The cucumber step is: @When("^I open the (.*) (pdf) in a new tab$")

      Parameters:
      text_to_verify - String the text string expected to appear in the currently open PDF file
      firstPageNumber - int the page to check or the first page in the range if the second value is not null
      lastPageNumber - Integer the last page in the range; indicates to only check one page if set to null
      Throws:
      java.lang.Throwable - if any errors are raised they will fail the current test
